content.description: Start in the back of the 'Slowdance Cave', on the left side at good jugs. Traverse right on high jugs to a harder move into good right-slanting flake. Climb up the steep flake using good holds then straight up good jugs into alcove some 18 feet up. From the alcove, either top out straight up on very high jugs, or traverse off left above Rave.
Start matched on good left facing finger jug and conjure your way straight up the crimps with some toehook trickery. Super sick!
content.protection: a couple pads and a good spot for one move in particular.
content.location: Opposite of Rave (V7), finishes at the same spot as All-Nighter (V3) but starts further right nearer the corner

content.description: Same start as for Slow Dance on the small hole / pocket. Make a few moves to gain the crack trending right (crux). Finish on All-Nighter. A 360 campus may be helpful.
content.protection: Thin pads or no pads. You'll likely dab if you have anything too big.

content.description: Lay down / sit start below Weekender on the small hole / pocket. Pull on to really sharp right hand side pull. Make a few hard moves out left to gain the jugs. Drop off or climb Weekender.

A tuff bouldering classic: powerful, yet technical, and immensely satisfying. Grab the pumice banana and a small right crimp and pull a couple steep moves to the big sloper. Keep it tight for a radical sequence through the large dish to a gaston, and finally, a baseball-sized pocket and the huge shelf. Beautiful.

(Word has it the starting pinch and a crucial foot have been steadily disintegrating over time, so step lightly and/or get this done quick.)

Stand start on the sloper goes at v5
content.protection: A couple pads and a spot for the crux - the landing is very good.
content.location: In the Slow Dance Cave, this takes a pretty obvious line from the banana hold up and slightly left. The high class 4 topout is not essential but sure makes getting off the boulder easier.

content.description: Sit start and climb the diagonal seam to slopers and finish up right.

Sit-start to the right of 'Rave' and 'Fast Dance' on two opposing side-pull crimps.  Climb directly to the jugs above.  Coolness factor is highly beta-dependent - try doing it in two moves (I won't ruin the surprise for you (look at the photos if you want the beta), but doing it this way makes it one of the most fun problems at the Happies IMO, and preserves the grade as well.)
content.location:
'Slow Dance Cave', right side of left wall

(See topo)

content.description: Sit start to Standing Kill Order. Adds a 2 or 3 burly moves
content.protection: a couple pads and a good spot off the rock at your 5 o'clock
content.location: Sit start to Standing Kill Order

content.description: SDS as Rave, after first move go right to finish on LAST DANCE

Stand start matched at good crimp incut and make a huge move left to a good hold and then climb upwards on improving holds and top out as for All-Nighter. A good problem for those able to do The Weekender and for those who are looking to step it up a bit. Get this line dialed then go for the sit start!

This climb is named after a song by David Bowie.

In memory of him and Dave Mirra.
content.location: This is the stand start for Dance the Night Away.

content.description: Sit start as for Kill on Sight but once you grab the finger jug make a big throw out left to a jug.(This is where everyone toe hooks for Kill on Sight) Make a tricky match and continue up on the weekender. A good problem. Getting off the ground and snagging the first move is the crux.

Stand start with both hands in the good bucket at the bottom of the flake of Weekender. Make powerful moves up and right to a big knob, then straight up on jugs to a bit of an alcove. Either muster your courage and proceed straight up on jugs (easy but steep and very high) or traverse off to the left and step down onto the boulder above Rave.
content.protection: Pad and spot would be a good idea.
content.location: Above and to the right of slowdance lies this obvious right slanting flake.
